english: I study Korean every day.
This is my friend's book.
The weather is very good today.
Tomorrow I will watch a movie with my friend.
Yesterday I bought a lot of fruit at the market.
On weekends, I usually rest at home.
Do you really like Korean food?

spoken: 저는 매일 아침 일곱 시에 일어나요.
expected: 저는 매일 아침 일곱 시에 일어나요.
reading: 저는 매일 아침 일곱 시에 일어나요.
english: I wake up at 7 AM every morning.
My younger sibling studies at the library now.
Does this bus go towards City Hall?

spoken: 저는 김치를 조금 먹을 수 있어요.
expected: 저는 김치를 조금 먹을 수 있어요.
reading: 저는 김치를 조금 머글 수 이써요.
english: I can eat a little Kimchi.
The student cafeteria food is cheap and delicious.
My name is Kim Minjun.
My whole family lives in Seoul.
I didn't go to school today.
I will call my friend in the evening.
How much is this pretty clothing?
Please give me a glass of cold water.
I commute to work by subway.
That person is not a student.
I often watch Korean dramas.

reading: 이 사과 는 달고 아주 마시써요.
english: This apple is sweet and very delicious.
Do you have time on Saturday afternoon?
I came to Korea for the first time last year.
I bought a pretty bag at the department store.
My younger sibling swims better than me.
I'm very tired, so I want to sleep early.
Whose umbrella is this?
My computer is on the desk.
Today's lunch menu is Kimchi stew.

spoken: 저는 매운 음식을 잘 못 먹어요.
expected: 저는 매운 음식을 잘 못 먹어요.
reading: 저는 매운 음식을 잘 못 머거요.
english: I can't eat spicy food well.
I'm worried because there's an exam next week.
Do you know a delicious restaurant near the school?
I took a walk with my dog together in the park.
I eat bread and milk in the morning.
I received a letter from my Korean friend.
Today the weather isn't colder than yesterday.
Jeju Island is a really beautiful island.

reading: 도서과 는 아침 아홉씨부터 저녁 여서씨까지 해요.
english: The library is open from 9 AM to 6 PM.
My hometown is very close to Busan.

spoken: 요즘 한국 노래를 많이 듣고 있어요.
expected: 요즘 한국 노래를 많이 듣고 있어요.
reading: 요즘 한국 노래를 마니 듣꼬 이써요.
english: These days I am listening to a lot of Korean songs.
I want to finish reading this book.
I took many pictures at the museum.
We do homework together every day.
I don't particularly like exercising.

spoken: 내일 친구 생일 파티에 갈 거예요.
expected: 내일 친구 생일 파티에 갈 거예요.
reading: 내일 친구 생일 파티에 갈 거예요.
english: I will go to my friend's birthday party tomorrow.
Please open the window a little.
Studying Korean is very fun.
I am waiting for the bus now.
The movie I watched yesterday was really sad.
Please sit here for a moment.
I usually sleep in on weekends.
I caught a cold, so I took medicine.
What is inside the bag?
What is the name of this food?
It was raining outside, so I brought an umbrella.
I like K-pop idol groups.
Where is the subway station?
That Korean book is too difficult.
I often wear blue shirts.
I didn't have time, so I took a taxi.
Korea's summer weather is very hot.
I will review the words I learned today.
I waited for my friend in front of the museum.
I watch Korean news every day.

reading: 제가 만든 케이 크를 친구에게 주어써요.
english: I gave the cake I made to my friend.
This restaurant is very famous for Bulgogi.
What time is it exactly now?

spoken: 저는 요리하는 것을 잘 못 해요.
expected: 저는 요리하는 것을 잘 못 해요.
reading: 저는 요리하는 거슬 잘 모 태요.
english: I am not good at cooking.
I want to reserve a plane ticket bound for Busan.
My house is very far from school.
The acting of the actors in that drama is good.

spoken: 저는 자기 전에 항상 이를 닦아요.
expected: 저는 자기 전에 항상 이를 닦아요.
reading: 저는 자기 저네 항상 이를 다까요.
english: I always brush my teeth before sleeping.
Could you please hold this for me?

spoken: 여름 휴가 때 제주도에 여행 갈 거예요.
expected: 여름 휴가 때 제주도에 여행 갈 거예요.
reading: 여름 휴가 때 제주도에 여행 갈 거예요.
english: I will travel to Jeju Island during the summer vacation.

spoken: 그 가게는 옷도 팔고 신발도 팔아요.
expected: 그 가게는 옷도 팔고 신발도 팔아요.
reading: 그 가게는 얻 또 팔고 신발도 파라요.
english: That store sells clothes and also sells shoes.

spoken: 오늘 숙제가 너무 많아서 조금 힘들어요.
expected: 오늘 숙제가 너무 많아서 조금 힘들어요.
reading: 오늘 숙쩨가 너무 마나서 조끔 힘드러요.
english: I have too much homework today, so it's a bit hard.

spoken: 제 여동생은 그림을 아주 잘 그려요.
expected: 제 여동생은 그림을 아주 잘 그려요.
reading: 제 여동생은 그리믈 아주 잘 그려요.
english: My younger sister draws pictures very well.

spoken: 저는 아침 식사로 밥하고 국을 먹어요.
expected: 저는 아침 식사로 밥하고 국을 먹어요.
reading: 저는 아침 식싸로 바파고 구글 머거요.
english: I eat rice and soup for breakfast.

spoken: 시험을 잘 봐서 기분이 정말 좋아요.
expected: 시험을 잘 봐서 기분이 정말 좋아요.
reading: 시허믈 잘 봐서 기부니 정말 조아요.
english: I did well on the test, so I feel really good.
Most Korean people are really kind.
I go hiking with friends every weekend.
I want to send this parcel to the USA.
I'm sorry, but please speak a little more slowly.

spoken: 그 식당은 점심 시간에 손님이 많아요.
expected: 그 식당은 점심 시간에 손님이 많아요.
reading: 그 식땅은 점심 시가네 손니미 마나요.
english: That restaurant has many customers during lunchtime.
I majored in Korean language at university.

spoken: 피아노를 칠 수 있지만 잘 못 쳐요.
expected: 피아노를 칠 수 있지만 잘 못 쳐요.
reading: 피아노를 칠 수 이찌만 잘몯 처요.
english: I can play the piano, but I don't play well.
I want to learn traditional Korean culture.

spoken: 저녁 식사 후에 가족과 공원에서 산책했어요.
expected: 저녁 식사 후에 가족과 공원에서 산책했어요.
reading: 저녁 식싸 후에 가족꽈 공워네서 산채캐써요.
english: After dinner, I took a walk with my family in the park.

spoken: 이 빨간색 컴퓨터는 제 여동생의 것이에요.
expected: 이 빨간색 컴퓨터는 제 여동생의 것이에요.
reading: 이 빨간색 컴퓨터는 제 여동생의 거시에요.
english: This red computer is my younger sister's.

spoken: 다음 달에 한국 친구가 우리 집에 올 거예요.
expected: 다음 달에 한국 친구가 우리 집에 올 거예요.
reading: 다음 따레 한국 친구가 우리 지베 올 거예요.
english: Next month, my Korean friend will come to my house.

spoken: 저는 매운 떡볶이를 전혀 못 먹어요.
expected: 저는 매운 떡볶이를 전혀 못 먹어요.
reading: 저는 매운 떡뽀끼를 저녀 못 머거요.
english: I can't eat spicy Tteokbokki at all.

spoken: 은행은 보통 아홉 시에 문을 열어요.
expected: 은행은 보통 아홉 시에 문을 열어요.
reading: 으 냉은 보통 아홉 씨에 무 늘 여러요.
english: Banks usually open at nine o'clock.

spoken: 오늘은 미세먼지가 심해서 마스크를 꼭 썼어요.
expected: 오늘은 미세먼지가 심해서 마스크를 꼭 썼어요.
reading: 오느른 미세먼지가 심해서 마스크를 꼭 써써요.
english: The fine dust is bad today, so I made sure to wear a mask.
I don't have a Korean driver's license yet.
Teacher Kim teaches Korean to the students.
I will do a part-time job during the vacation.
That singer's voice is really beautiful.
I usually take a shower before going to bed.

spoken: 이 길로 쭉 가면 지하철역이 나와요.
expected: 이 길로 쭉 가면 지하철역이 나와요.
reading: 이 길로 쭉 가면 지하철려기 나와요.
english: If you go straight down this road, the subway station will appear.
